thread.title: Telegraph Junior Golf 2015: Louisa Brunt aims to make experience count as returning finalist
thread.title_full: Telegraph Junior Golf 2015: Louisa Brunt aims to make experience count as returning finalist - Telegraph

author: Rod Gilmour
title: Telegraph Junior Golf 2015: Louisa Brunt aims to make experience count as returning finalist
text: • Latest Telegraph Junior Ch'ship news • Boys' finalists profiles GIRLS' FINALISTS Megan Clarke The 16-year-old England squad member heads to the Algarve as top qualifier, following her -5 round in lifting the Yorkshire junior championship title by seven shots. It was the first time she'd shot under par, a round which saw her handicap drop from three to one. Jade Guest The Cambridgeshire (Gog Magog) junior won her first Cambridgeshire and Huntingdonshire Junior Girls' Championship. Heads to Portugal with a top 15 finish at the English under-16 Girls. • Read how 2014 Telegraph winners fared at BMW Pro-Am Olivia Hamilton The new Cleckeaton junior captain's stock continues to rise with a first Telegraph finals’ appearance. As a 12-year-old, in 2012, she became Yorkshire's under-18 girls' champion. Louisa Anne Brunt The talented Bury junior assured successive Telegraph junior final appearances with a -3 round at Northenden. Sixth last year in the Algarve, she aspires to earn a US golf scholarship. Jasmine Campbell Makes her Telegraph finals' debut and is a past winner of the Abraham Trophy for England’s most improved golfer. The Royal Norwich junior shot -2 gross during her assault on the Norfolk ladies' title. Chloe Howard Managed to combine her golf season with a healthy set of GCSE results and the Plymouth junior is rewarded with an end-of-year Telegraph finals' berth. Third at the under-16 Scottish Girls. • See the illustrious winners on our roll of honours' boards Olivia Mehaffey The Royal County Down rising star's 2015 order of merit win last month secured an exemption to next year's Ricoh Women’s British Open at Woburn. A GB & Ireland Vagliano team member. Eloise Healey Last year's English Schools National Championship winner, her form has taken her to the England Girls' under-18 squad. Second at the 2014 Faldo Series. Cloe Frankish Kent's under-16 scratch junior finished runner-up at the North of England at Heswall and heads to Portugal after an 11th place finish at the Belgian under-18 international. Net winners The two under-18 Net winners who will travel out to the Algarve to experience the Finals are Constance Brooks of Gaudet Luce, and Worcester's Ben Wadley. The pair had the best net scores against the competition standard scratch of all qualifying winners in the boys' and girls' events. Follow the latest news, leaderboards , images and build-up to October’s Finals on Twitter @TelegraphJunior and on our Facebook page
